WorkItem.Description:
Here's a [video](http://www.screencast.com/t/jIuwGWol) of the problem

I'm using a TI-84+ 2.55 MP ROM running with Wabbitemu 1.7.2.11 in cutout mode, Windows 7 Home Premium 64 bit.

The skin becomes transparent when opened, and the buttons become misaligned... I have to click above the bottons to have them register. 

No issues when not in cutout mode. Bug?

Comments.Message:
I have the exact same issue.
Sure, it can be "fixed" by not using the cutout skin, but it's so much nicer looking with the cutout.

I believe I fixed this issue, but I'm not quite sure how to reproduce it. Can you test this new Wabbitemu and tell me if the issue still occurs? http://buckeyedude.zapto.org/Revsoft/Wabbitemu/Beta/Wabbitemu.exe

Thanks,
BuckeyeDude

Hi,

thanks for the update. Unfortunately, the behavior hasn't changed.
On startup, everything is fine, but after two seconds, the skin drops exactly 20 pixels.

The close and minimize button remain the same, screen stays stationary, and the place to click a button also stays the same.
But since the skin is now dropped 20 pix, you have to click above the buttons to activate them.

![Image](http://i39.tinypic.com/2m78aro.jpg)

Interesting. Since it is exactly 20 pixels, that tells me its related to the menu bar (which isn't show in cutout mode), but appears to be affect the sizing. I've uploaded another version of Wabbit with some changes that might fix this, try downloading it again from the same link.

More importantly, I'd like to understand why I can't reproduce this issue. If you could, I'd like to export your Wabbitemu settings. You can do so by:
1. Pressing WinKey+R
2. Entering the following command:
```
regedit /e "%UserProfile%\Wabbitemu.reg" HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Wabbitemu
```
This will export Wabbitemu.reg to your user directory (eg C:\Users\\[username]\Wabbitemu.reg). Can you upload this file so I can look at your settings? I'd also like to know any settings in Windows you're using that may affect the menu bar. This means settings such as theme, language options, accessibility settings, etc, ways you may have customized Windows that would effect Wabbitemu. In the mean time I'll continue to test and look for ways to cause and fix this.

[TEXT](http://speedy.sh/nMJTB/Wabbitemu.reg)

Is the file you requested. This is extracted prior to the installation of the new version you just posted.
Win 7 64 ultimate, running pretty much stock as far as themes and visualisation go....

I7 processor, 16GB ram, Running on SSD and ramdisk. (wabbit is installed on SSD, ramdisk is for autocad)
